title: trevrice.com
description: For my portfolio site, I aimed for a minimalist aesthetic, using a single typeface and only two colors. This ended up being the perfect opportunity to try out a few new technologies, particularly React, Gulp and Jekyll. The original plan was to build a single-page application with React and React Router to mimic a ‘typical’ website. Gulp was used to transpile ES6 JavaScript to ES5 (with the help of Babel and Browserify) and compile SCSS to CSS. After completing roughly eighty percent of the site (and learning a lot), in the end, I decided that I actually wanted users to have the ‘typical’ multi-page experience. Using Jekyll, I was able to generate a simple static site from a content-filled JSON file. A few Gulp tasks were used to build and deploy my Jekyll site.

title: Leo Burnett Internship
description: During my time at Leo Burnett Interactive, I developed, maintained and fixed defects on various websites for internal and client projects, including Allstate, ComEd and Marwen. One of my biggest responsibilities was developing the website for Leo Burnett’s 80th anniversary in collaboration with the two other interns. I was also exposed to various APIs, including Google Maps, YouTube, Vimeo, Facebook and Twitter.
technologies: SASS, JavaScript(jQuery), BoltCMS, Wordpress, Tumblr, Foundation, Grunt, SourceTree, Video.js

title: Cosmic Calendar
description: Inspired by both Cosmos: A Personal Voyage and Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey, I decided to create a website to help visualize the universe. Three.js was used to create the 3D celestial objects.
